document.title: Human Services Career Cluster Food Science

B746E69D1FA848BBA87DFB27178577F6.description:
Compare and contrast processes used for home and commercial preservation and
evaluate resulting quality of the products preserved using different commercial and/or
home methods.

EEB59910D6E648F697DF3A3135BD178F.description:
Examine the processes of curing, dehydration, freeze-drying, and extended shelf life of
fresh products (refrigeration, modified atmosphere packaging and irradiation).

62D83C186781413E9F833B5BD9DEABF7.description:
Examine the factors to be considered in the selection and use of successful thermalprocessing techniques (canning, freezing and pasteurization) and describe commercial
thermal-processing methods.

E64BC11178BC48358DA5DA8EF01968E2.description:
Explain the importance of product pH and final water activity of the processed product to
preservation of foods.

6E77A0CC9F6844AF9EF04C901B8FB671.description:
Discuss reduced oxygen packaging and the effects on product quality and availability of
products in the marketplace.

C4A56E4807904FF48366EF048E84F001.description:
Identify common types of packaging materials, and compare and contrast the properties
of containers made from different packaging materials and selection criteria.

EF8DE5A5310244CE91A9763908ECFD64.description:
Identify the major functions of packaging used for food products, differentiating between
the functions of primary, secondary and tertiary packaging.

D4F42EC954AC420EA2A61D07598EA839.description: Describe and provide examples of the continuum of processed foods.

4A8580541FDF4504B35AA5C084082FF3.description:
Compare and contrast different food preservation methods and the resultant quality of
preserved food.

BD82DCA2E0884CDBBF5424F31A195907.description: Identify government agencies in the United States that regulate the food supply.

0CA75E2B1B2C455F862FD127792BD3EF.description: Describe the common causes of food spoilage and steps to reduce/prevent spoilage.

07724FC6318E4BEC875D40FE9050816B.description:
Discuss sanitation and food handling and processing practices used to produce
wholesome foods during the processing, preparation, consumption and storage of food.

238BCBB9628F485FA624337A4CF49FB3.description:
Define toxin, pathogen and parasite and differentiate between food intoxication and food
infection.

AF39DFFB0A9643598DBDD0EDADF916C2.description: List specific microbial organisms that can cause food-borne illness.

4168C3B556514EEA8B703E2A0672837A.description: Differentiate among food borne illness, food spoilage and food sanitation.

EA8CE0094D4640DEA1300BA03165A938.description: Discuss the three major types of food contaminants: physical, chemical, and biological.

04611A98B1554C27B0F5E6A76C626D26.description:
Investigate measures used to produce safe and wholesome food under sanitary
conditions.

6F8AB52B0CA348FC893046E562280332.description:
Describe the making of a fermented food product, such as vinegar, cheese, yogurt or
chocolate.

E54EBC91C3BB49278CDD97E29CD69BF6.description:
Describe the process of pickling and compare and contrast the use of fermentation
versus the addition of vinegar to produce cucumber pickles.

C4C99E83A1BA44DDBE6739E68688B8EF.description: List the factors that impact the growth of single-celled organisms.

AD5F476EAA594265A8552CA5BD492296.description:
Differentiate among yeast, bacterial and mold fermentation and identify food products
produced for each type of fermentation.

88EF3981E4C64D218A59F3F217817850.description: Define probiotics and the relationship to fermented foods and the benefits for gut health.

2FBDC60F82AB4A6296E712FFCF1CC203.description:
List the reasons that food is fermented and identify common food products that result
from fermentation.

F2D2855BC3AE49C2B5AC1A10D301F362.description:
Conduct a sensory evaluation of foods with and without food additives/analogs and
compile the data and examine the results.

B98744ADDD5648DEB2C7D30D0831F07F.description:
Explore the impact of the use of substitutes for fat, sugar, and salt on product quality
characteristics and nutrient content.

626718F2D7544668BE5BDABF966FB74D.description: Define food analog and list the main reasons for their use.

2CA1CB340AF24CC1AF16B8E910E1DA65.description: Explain the difference between natural and artificial additives.

DF7A94E7190D4E898A9C75577FE39FF1.description:
Identify regulations governing the approval and use of food additives and the agencies
involved.

D7F3CD228B404AC898AD289FE7EEE5BF.description:
Define food additives, discuss the various purposes of food additives in food products,
and identify advantages and disadvantages of their use.

DEC2085920FD48F0AE26314C8527A61B.description:
Investigate the reasons for the use of food additives and food analogs in food
preparation and in processed products.

815CE015ABFD4980AD052A3387C4B8CE.description:
Define functional foods and explore types of functional foods currently in the
marketplace and the potential to impact health.

EECCE66BD60A4B7B8C82F87A99251B61.description:
Explain the impact of food preparation, food processing and preservation methods on
nutrient value and bioavailability of phytochemicals.

A7B60BF719A442DC95F02E248BFCAE37.description:
Define enrichment/fortification, list ideal characteristics of the food fortified or enriched
and discuss the role in meeting nutrient needs of the population.

B6BA8DD9E3ED47069E540CDCEEDF1B34.description:
List the key vitamins, minerals, and phytochemicals present in food and identify foods
that are major sources of each food constituent and their role in promoting health.

D0EB99950E6844339BE71112EEA75AD0.description:
Differentiate between nutrient and phytochemical and indicate the role of each in
promoting health.

607C1B4E787B425A8185A8B07990747B.description:
Investigate the sources, and impact of food formulations, preparation and preservation
on food constituents important to health.

8E71CC17E5D844B88B28338A3C2D07EE.description:
Define enzyme, including the nomenclature and mechanism of action, identify factors
that control enzymatic activity and discuss examples of positive and negative enzymatic
effects in food products.

8E030B8F5FE34F8FBED778095A544BC8.description:
Explain coagulation and apply basic principles of the chemistry to prepare high-protein
foods such as eggs, milk and meat products.

5DF95D9F88F9465C93E830D26D766724.description:
Explain what happens during the denaturation of protein and illustrate how the process
occurs using acids, enzymes and salts and mechanical action.

4F930147AED5437F891CA49881A379F3.description: Describe the functional roles of protein in food products.

7B831652312549A5A6B9A854190E63E5.description: Describe the chemical structure and organization of proteins.

D352B3A00A564CDD8A03A6807D8F72D0.description:
Summarize why proteins are important in food preparation and preservation and the
nutritional impact they have on diet.

D9E1BE33004D4560B79A57921D66334E.description:
List and describe the types and causes of fat degradation and mechanisms used in the
control.

E5615C4EF30E40559C2862B7258E7793.description:
Describe mono and diglycerides and phospholipids and their function as emulsifiers in
food products.

CBB0C279A6AA4A16AE165FDD95CE8F08.description:
Examine the functions of lipids in food preparation and analyze the nutritional impact of
lipids in the diet.

C392D7B0B17640B39513936960E7A558.description:
Identify and compare the functional properties of triglycerides classified as
monounsaturated, polyunsaturated, saturated and trans and list the advantages and
disadvantages of their use in food preparation.

2FF7CE7E79B34758A56F1FD0C0AF4622.description: Describe the structure of saturated, monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fatty acids.

4361E5980F39495F872CD2952274FE54.description:
Identify fats present in food and differentiate between triglycerides, phospholipids, and
sterols and stanols.

BA54C1990332496BA12AFADC571FFFE4.description:
Summarize why lipids are important in food preparation and preservation and the
nutritional impact they have on diet.

91C7D882713948A392D695EB900EAC9E.description:
Compare and contrast starches and non-starch-based polysaccharides and the role as
food ingredients.

E75287231D38451E8BC5B8DC14418311.description:
Define and identify the functions of simple and complex carbohydrates, define
monosaccharides and disaccharides, and identify the role and function of sugars in food
products.

629977D1BEBB454E89ABBBF7FB73BA49.description:
Summarize why carbohydrates are important in food preparation, preservation, and the
nutritional impact on diets.

B8A8FC7B41754D6586F624D10C712EF7.description: Describe the pH scale and demonstrate how to measure pH.

DE0C1E7BBA1D4D99A14BE1A8729D6789.description:
Discuss ionization, using water as an example, and the relationship to the formation of
acids and bases.

B01C0475691342DEB4D0F513BC1E5C84.description:
Define acid, base and salt, and identify sensory properties and roles in determining the
quality characteristics (color, flavor, texture) and safety of food.

38F64230FB274C01A900959328E72B8D.description: List the common sources of water and the common contaminants.

ED33F714E7564F19A11E3C1F212920FA.description:
Define and differentiate between water content and water activity and relate their
importance to food preparation/preservation and storage using representative examples.

9AE7C5501CA145EC8CEC0C411C421373.description: Describe the three states of water and the transition between states, (i.e. phase changes).

A1751EAD41C14595A2E6BEDD631C3EC7.description:
Describe and demonstrate the functions and identify factors that alter the functional
properties of water (addition of solutes such as salt and sugar; atmospheric pressure).

08E2F834940744E9A02C6A626C5BBEC6.description:
Explain the importance of water as a food constituent and explain the relationship
between the molecular structure of water and the functional properties of water (melting
point, boiling point, role as a solvent and disperser, heat transfer medium).

D20C9B959FC24707877F269B7B618596.description: Examine why water and acidity are important factors in food preparation and preservation.

DF68FF7A0E2341969D491A181BE163C8.description:
Compare the effect of various temperatures on rates of chemical and physical
reactions.

07772E73DF684CC788F3E98FA6C71865.description:
Explain and demonstrate how heat is transferred via conduction, convection and
radiation.

EAF1D852FF73410F8A73A809CD94A598.description: Observe how energy works in food preparation and preservation.

4E2B292665EE4CE99BA48591CB474E95.description:
Define and differentiate between chemical and physical changes during food
preparation and preservation.

EE0C176795C642A0889B3325E34B41E4.description:
Identify the classes of organic compounds important in food (hydrocarbons, alcohols,
aldehydes, ketones, acids and amines) and the characterizing features of their
structural formulas.

5B2D91AC028C4E3483244D48E018688B.description:
Differentiate between organic and inorganic compounds and classify the major food
constituents as organic (carbohydrates, fat, protein, vitamins) or inorganic (water,
minerals).

136504232D3B4CB5A8CEC70C8044D5D7.description:
Describe the formation of compounds via ionic and covalent bonding and the
representation of the reactions in balanced chemical equations for simple
compounds such as salt and water.

8F1D45B5A9BB4AFF9F900071D2A39B8F.description:
Recognize chemical symbols on the periodic table for common elements found in
food and their role as the building blocks for compounds in food.

BD4EF59C28AB41ECBAD27A9C1839D897.description:
Define matter and compare and contrast substances (elements and compounds)
and mixtures (homogenous and heterogeneous).

A8E7764A9FDD442791EA1851FDB888F3.description: Explore the basic chemistry concepts of food science.

A4F2092F3C28418CB3ACD0C867B44464.description: Explore the basic chemistry concepts of food science.

8C9BB4C49B2C4D91B6D1FD1D093CBC01.description:
Identify equipment found in the food science laboratory and how to properly and
safely use it.

EC3CAEC504FB4F7CB77D477FFC6F5B56.description:
Describe the role of science in the development of new food products and the use of
the scientific method.

2FD03ED2EB0C490DA0A2A169DD163DFD.description:
Explain what sensory evaluation panels do and conduct a sensory panel using
appropriate controls and quantify and analyze the data.

F093921A081F4634B496F0B2C633053D.description:
Define sensory evaluation, identify the qualities that make-up the sensory
characteristics of food, and explain how taste, aroma and the mouth feel sensations
combined to give food their flavor.

D67CA30AE1A14BA9BB32481A652B9754.description:
Identify physical, physicochemical, and chemical techniques used for assessing food
quality.

3A1A9AD462B947C9A787E1B90979F9D0.description: Investigate how and why scientific evaluation of foods is conducted.

887C4BBB39694A1F87B06560FA7D50A2.description: Evaluate and list careers in food science and list the educational requirements.

0F832BAE979B4DDBB984EB9F0A65FF48.description: Analyze how studying food science can benefit one in the future.

DAC0B642EF654463BC8929A1E2FE1718.description:
Describe the history of the development of food and food systems emphasizing the
transition from hunting and gathering to farming and then to market-based societies.

FF26EA47BEAC48C694EDEBC0B3BC6B29.description:
Define the study of food science and summarize how food products and processing
methods have changed in modern history due to contributions of food scientists.

553C5DF38BA9473DA266AEE00F37D7D0.description: Define food science and explore careers in food science.

67964A1996B449E4B741A0CAECCCA896.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

2B0D4D4A04714E229B3158F7F250C49B.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace
to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

0BFCD1FFA35B476593B0509110203BE4.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

311B74F8789743EEB033A3FBA92E375F.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

4855BE12B8824593A26169659F34FB46.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

7EEFDE23C7104D10A87CC3DBF533FC2C.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

F8BF31EC541448698C4BF51DFCAAFE4B.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
